p: HSV is an uncommon cause of hepatitis in immunocompetent patients. A mild asymptomatic elevation of aminotransferase levels can be detected in 14 % of healthy adults with genital infection [ 79]. Fulminant hepatitis with more than 100-fold rise in aminotransferases was reported and associated with a favorable outcome after antiviral therapy [ 80]. The incidence of HSV hepatitis was reported to be up to 6 % of fulminant hepatitis cases.
